These symptoms should be looked for at each consultation, as some carers will not talk about them spontaneously, or the symptoms may be trivialised. The Neuro-Psychiatric Inventory can be used to assess the frequency and impact (severity) of each of these symptoms.
{| class="wikitable"
|Depression/dysphoria

Anxiety

Irritability/stability

Apathy

Exaltation/euphoria

Disinhibition

Delusional ideas

Hallucinations Agitation/aggression

Aberrant motor behaviour

Sleep disorders

Appetite disorders
|}
These can have major consequences in terms of :

* quality of life and adaptation of patients to their environment;
* quality of care, with the risk of abuse or neglect;
* functional prognosis of the disease
* inappropriate drug prescribing;
* increased risk of hospitalisation and institutionalisation;
* quality of life and physical and mental health of carers.

question.title: What are the potential consequences of neglecting to identify and address behavioral symptoms of dementia?

option_a.title: Improved quality of life and adaptation of patients to their environment
option_a.description: A plausible but incorrect option that might reflect a common misconception about the impact of neglecting behavioral symptoms

option_b.title: Increased risk of hospitalization and institutionalization
option_b.description: A correct option that aligns with the potential consequences of neglecting behavioral symptoms

option_c.title: Appropriate drug prescribing and reduced risk of abuse or neglect
option_c.description: An incorrect option that might reflect a misunderstanding about the relationship between neglecting behavioral symptoms and drug prescribing

option_d.title: Enhanced functional prognosis of the disease
option_d.description: An incorrect option that might reflect a misconception about the impact of neglecting behavioral symptoms on disease prognosis

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The letter corresponding to the correct option
